options.title: Ready cannons and fire when ready.
results: (80) They prepare to return fire. Attack!
(20) You launch a devastating volley a the ship. They were no match for firepower of that magnitude! [+10 food, +25 coin]

options.title: Sail closer and attempt to get a better look.
results: (50) As you sail closer you see the words "death bringer" burned into the ship's hull. Not today! [fight the ship]
(50) You vomit uncontrollably in fear, while the rest of your crew dies without leadership. [Game over]

options.title: Attempt to sail away.
results: (60) You sail away from the vessel without incident. Who were they?
(40) The ship reveals itself as the "death bringer". It is both a name and a mission statement. [fight the ship]

description: One of your crew was vomiting through the night. People are growing concerned that he may have contracted a plague.

options.title: Allow the man to rest and recover. Hopefully he won't be a danger to your crew.
results: (50) the man soon recovers and thanks you for not casting him to the waves!
(35) the man sadly dies and your crew is quick to the throw the body overboard. A pirate's funeral is brief.
(15) the man dies but not before contaminating some of your food supply. What a waste! [-max(8,foodSupply/4)]

options.title: Throw the man to the mercy of the sea. Let one pirate die to save the rest.
results: (80) your crew throws the man overboard. He screams but the sea soon silences him.
(20) you throw the man to a watery grave and a profound sadness overcomes you. You wonder why you ever became a pirate.

description:
A man stumbles towards you as you walk on board your first command.

“Welcome aboard, Cap’n! We be glad to be servin’ ye. I'll be yer first-mate, One-eye Peg-leg. Crew is fixin’ fer a ripe shakedown, but first we be needin’ what all pirate crews be needin’—a few cases o’ grog fer plunderin’,” he turns laughing with the crew behind him. “Y’know, fer, uh... bondin’ purposes n’ such.

“Now, if ye just be givin’ us what we owed, we can see to puttin’ this fine vessel to sea first-thing in the mornin’...”

options.title: “Ah, yes, my good fellow! Wouldn't be a proper christening without some grog for the celebration. I will return posthaste, with all the drink I can possibly carry!”
results: (50) the man soon recovers and thanks you for not casting him to the waves!
(35) the man sadly dies and your crew is quick to the throw the body overboard. A pirate's funeral is brief.
(15) the man dies but not before contaminating some of your food supply. What a waste! [-max(8,foodSupply/4)]

options.title: “We drink after leaving port. Let's go, men!” Your first act is a necessary compromise.
results: (80) your crew throws the man overboard. He screams but the sea soon silences him.
(20) you throw the man to a watery grave and a profound sadness overcomes you. You wonder why you ever became a pirate.

options.title: You punch One-eye in the gut and throw him overboard, soon after calling out to the other men, “Any other requests for your new Captain?”
results: (80) your crew throws the man overboard. He screams but the sea soon silences him.
(20) you throw the man to a watery grave and a profound sadness overcomes you. You wonder why you ever became a pirate.

description: Wreckage from a recent battle drifts toward your ship. A man is found floating aboard a ruined fragment of hull.

options.title: Bring the man aboard.
results: (40) He thanks you for rescuing him and offers to join your crew.
(30) Sadly, the sea has already claimed the man's life.
(15) In your attempt to rescue the man one of your crew slips and is swallowed by the sea.
(15) It seems that the sea has left this man crazed! He grabs one of your crew and jumps into the sea.

options.title: Leave the man to the mercy of the sea.
results: (80) You let the sea decide his fate.
(20) A cold wind blows overhead. You feel remorse.
